title: Have any music festivals such as Coachella, Lollapalooza or SXSW ever been more successful than the original Woodstock? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you're talking about financial success then the answer is: All of them have been, even when you adjust for inflation. If you're talking about cultural impact, then the answer is still yes. By this point in time, SXSW alone influences more music and film trends than Woodstock did.
Coachella serves a crowd of album 130,000 people so that's pretty telling of their success.
